list_definition.definition: to (cause to) go (often more widely or more thinly) over a surface

list_ex_of_definition.ex_of_definition: She spread honey thickly on her toast.
She spread the bread with jam.

list_definition.definition: to (cause to) reach a wider area, affect a larger number of people etc

list_ex_of_definition.ex_of_definition: The news spread through the village very quickly.

list_definition.definition: to distribute over a wide area, period of time etc

list_ex_of_definition.ex_of_definition: The exams were spread over a period of ten days.
He spread the map on the table.

list_definition.definition: the process of reaching a wider area, affecting more people etc

list_ex_of_definition.ex_of_definition: the spread of crime among schoolchildren.

list_definition.definition: something to be spread on bread etc
the space or time covered (by something) or the extent of spreading
